channel.title: Metals Industry News Feed
channel.description: Automated news feed for aluminum, steel, copper, and nickel industries

item.title: The first Energy Release contract in the Aosta Valley is underway: agreement signed between the CVA Group and Cogne Acciai Speciali
item.description: CVA will construct four new photovoltaic plants in Sicily with over 20 MW capacity, expected to produce 593,600 MWh fully operational by 2026. This marks the first Energy Release agreement in the Aosta Valley and supports Cogne Acciai Speciali's green energy transition and reduced environmental impact of production.

item.title: Cogne Acciai Speciali mulls expansion in U.S.
item.description: After four acquisitions over the past two years, Italian stainless steel and nickel alloy producer Cogne Acciai Speciali is considering further growth in the U.S. market. The company secured EUR 245 million through two capital increases to fund previous acquisitions and is preparing for its next expansion move.

item.title: Aluminum Falls from Over 3-Year High
item.description: Aluminum futures in the UK fell to $3,100 per tonne, retreating sharply from the over three-year high of $3,270 on January 28th as traders reconsidered speculative positions. Trading volumes for base metals in China remained at unprecedented highs, indicating position closures after metals tested peaks. Aluminum fell to 3,054.20 USD/T on February 2, down 2.04% from the previous day.

item.title: Uzbekistan Launches Its First Aluminum Can Plant with IFC Support to Drive Sustainable Production
item.description: Uzbekistan has launched its first greenfield aluminum can production plant in Tashkent with IFC's $18 million investment, aiming to supply recyclable metal packaging to beverage producers and reduce import reliance. The facility will produce up to 1.1 billion cans annually using energy-efficient equipment, create over 200 jobs, and align with climate goals through sustainable practices. IFC will also support environmental standards and green building certification.

item.title: Green Steel Production: Hydrogen Tech & Future Trends
item.description: This article examines hydrogen-driven green steel production technologies that are revolutionizing manufacturing in 2026, focusing on how hydrogen technology is transforming the steel industry toward more sustainable practices.

item.title: Copper Extends Losses in Broad Metal Selloff
item.description: Copper fell more than 5% to around $5.5 per pound on Monday, reaching one-month lows and extending losses from the prior session. The metal is down about 15% from last week’s all-time high amid a continued broader metals selloff.

item.title: Copper is down by 2.01%
item.description: Copper decreased 2.01% to 5.8051 USD/Lbs as part of recent market movements. This reflects short-term downward pressure in commodity trading.

item.title: The hidden powers of porous copper
item.description: Researchers at Arizona State University have developed a 3D-printing method using micro continuous liquid interface production (µCLIP) to create intricate copper components with nanoscale pores. This innovation allows engineering copper to intentionally oxidize for applications in information security, such as self-destructing chips exposed to air. The technology also supports sustainable manufacturing and medical implants that safely disintegrate.

item.title: Nickel Hits 4-week Low
item.description: Nickel decreased to 16,867 USD/T, marking the lowest price since January 2026. Over the past 4 weeks, nickel lost 2.38%, though it has increased 11.62% over the last 12 months. On February 2, 2026, nickel fell to 17,010 USD/T, down 3.10% from the previous day.

item.title: Nickel Declines from Recent Peak
item.description: Nickel futures in the UK sank to $17,700 per tonne after hovering near the 19-month high of $19,000 throughout January. The decline tracks drops in other base metals due to a rebounding dollar triggering the close of speculative positions. Contracts remain sharply higher since the start of the year.

item.title: Steel Prices Rising Again? February 2026 Metal Market Update
item.description: This market update discusses rising steel mill prices and extended lead times in the metal roofing industry, alongside tight aluminum supply reaching four-year price highs. The analysis covers how energy costs and winter weather are impacting production, why inventory levels remain lean across the supply chain, and recommendations for contractors managing Q1 and Q2 projects.

item.title: Nickel Prices Plunge as Macro Fund Outflows and High Inventories Weigh on Market
item.description: On February 2, 2026, nickel prices experienced limit-down declines due to macro fund outflows and high inventories, with LME stocks over 280,000 mt and domestic visible inventory elevated. China's refined nickel production rose 20% month-on-month in January, increasing supply pressure amid weak downstream demand. Short-term pressure persists, but Indonesian quota reductions could support a rebound.

item.title: Aluminum Hits 4-week Low
item.description: Aluminum decreased to 3031.00 USD/T, marking the lowest since January 2026. Over the past 4 weeks, prices gained 4.06%, and in the last 12 months, increased 20.13%. This reflects recent market volatility in the commodity.

item.title: What Contractors Need to Know About Metal Prices Right Now
item.description: Steel market prices continue to rise at domestic mills with slightly increased production. Discussion covers rising steel prices, extended lead times, energy impacts, and lean inventories. Advice for contractors on managing projects and margins amid volatility.

item.title: Creation of a Leading Gold and Copper Producer
item.description: Eldorado and Foran announce a transaction to combine into a leading gold and copper producer, with world-class projects like McIlvenna Bay and Skouries entering commercial production in mid-2026. The combined entity highlights high-margin free cash flow, strong balance sheet, and enhanced copper exposure from long-life assets. Emerging scanning technologies and orebody knowledge studies are redefining near-mine opportunities at McIlvenna Bay.

item.title: Rare Earth Newsletter (February 2, 2026) - A Weekly Intelligence Brief
item.description: This intelligence brief covers the U.S. critical minerals sector, noting 100% import reliance for 12 minerals and highlighting nickel's market volatility as a financing risk. The report identifies opportunities in stockpiling, diversification, and demand growth potential, with storage technology expected to outperform through 2030.

item.title: US aluminium prices break away as tariffs collide with global supply strain
item.description: US aluminium prices surged past USD 5000/tonne due to tariffs boosting domestic production like Century Aluminum's Mt. Holly restart (50kt idle capacity reactivated, full by June), falling imports, and shrinking stocks. Global strains include South32's Mozal smelter deactivation in Mozambique and Century's Grundartangi output cut by two-thirds in Iceland due to equipment issues.

item.title: Nuton: A better way to produce copper
item.description: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology is enabling the Johnson Camp mine to become the lowest-carbon primary copper producer, setting a new benchmark for sustainability in copper mining. The technology drives lower emissions and improved environmental performance. It represents a significant advancement in sustainable copper production methods.

item.title: FHE materials bend the rules
item.description: Screen-printed copper-based circuits for flexible hybrid electronics (FHE) offer cost-efficiency, mechanical flexibility, and environmental benefits. These innovations expand possibilities in electronics manufacturing. The technology emphasizes sustainability through reduced material use and adaptability.

item.title: [SMM Nickel Sulphate Daily Review] February 3: Weak Sentiment in Both Purchasing and Sales, Nickel Salt Prices Decline
item.description: On February 3, the SMM battery-grade nickel sulphate index price stood at 31,939 yuan/mt. Weak sentiment affected both purchasing and sales, leading to declining prices for nickel salt. This reflects ongoing market pressures in the nickel sulphate segment.

item.title: Aluminum and copper prices take breather after explosive start to 2026
item.description: Aluminum prices steadied at $3,197.50 a ton on the LME, the highest in over three years, following a strong start to 2026 amid bullish industrial metals run. Concerns include potential softening Chinese demand and geopolitical risks from US tariffs on countries trading with Iran.

item.title: Prysmian signs €2.3 billion contract for UK power link project
item.description: Italian cable maker Prysmian has signed a contract worth over €2.3 billion with SP Energy Networks and National Grid to build a power link between Scotland and England. The project, called Eastern Green Link 4, will connect the electrical grids of Scotland and England as part of a significant infrastructure project for the Italian firm.

item.title: US ALUMINUM: Historically wide spreads in prime scrap market change 2026 contract behavior
item.description: Wide spreads in US aluminum scrap markets, driven by record Midwest premiums, tariff uncertainty, and supply-demand shifts, are disrupting 2026 contracts. UBC scrap prices averaged 111.25 cents/lb in January, at 46% of MWT costs, down from prior norms. Buyers and sellers hesitate on long-term deals amid policy volatility and scrap gluts.

item.title: Aluminum Prices Soar to Four-Year High, Creating a Divide in U.S. Industry
item.description: Aluminum prices on the LME have reached four-year highs, with US premiums exceeding $1 per pound, benefiting upstream producers like Alcoa and Century Aluminum while straining downstream manufacturers. Century Aluminum's Mt. Holly facility will add only 50,000 tons of capacity soon, insufficient to ease the supply deficit. Chinese producers profit from exports amid global tightness.

item.title: Robin Zeng: Unlocking the Sustainable Energy Era with Zero Carbon Technology
item.description: Dr. Robin Zeng, Chairman and CEO of CATL, discussed the future of sustainable energy, highlighting renewable energy applications and grid-forming energy storage technology. CATL has achieved industry-leading recovery rates of 99.6% for nickel and cobalt, and 96.5% for lithium, demonstrating commitment to circular economy principles in zero-carbon energy systems.

item.title: Pipe producer tightens its grip on giant Black Sea project with double contract win
item.description: Tenaris secured a double contract win for the Sakarya Gas Project in the Black Sea. The contracts involve providing advanced tubular and pipeline solutions for Phase 3 development in ultra-deepwater conditions. This strengthens Tenaris's involvement in Turkey's major offshore gas initiative.

item.title: Steel Stocks Rebound In 2026 | Demand, Prices, Margins In Focus
item.description: Metal stocks are rebounding in early 2026 due to improving demand, stable pricing, easing input costs, and better margins after a subdued 2025. Steel prices rose 3% month-on-month in December, with HRC up 2%, followed by January hikes. Volumes and prices are expected to inch higher amid higher supply outlook.

item.title: Copper Futures Decline Across Most Contracts on February 4, 2026
item.description: Copper futures prices fell across most contracts on February 4, 2026, with the high-volume March contract closing at 5.9755 dollars per pound, down 0.1110. The February contract dropped modestly to 5.9855 dollars per pound. Trading volume was lower, and near-term contracts showed a downward trend.

item.title: Momentum Technologies advances dual-track US processing for rare earths and battery materials
item.description: Momentum Technologies has commissioned a demonstration plant near Dallas, Texas with proprietary membrane solvent extraction (MSX) technology that compresses traditional solvent extraction into compact membrane reactors. The facility can process both battery materials and rare earth elements, with rare earth commissioning expected in mid-February 2026.

item.title: Robin Zeng: Unlocking the Sustainable Energy Era with Zero-Carbon Technology
item.description: Dr. Robin Zeng, Chairman and CEO of CATL, discussed the future of sustainable energy, highlighting CATL's achievements in renewable energy deployment and circular economy initiatives. The company has achieved industry-leading recovery rates of 99.6% for nickel and cobalt, and is developing innovative grid-forming energy storage technology to stabilize zero-carbon power systems.

item.title: Ivanhoe Electric Plans Expanded Copper, Nickel Exploration in Côte d'Ivoire in 2026
item.description: Ivanhoe Electric plans to accelerate copper and nickel exploration at the Samapleu-Grata project in Côte d'Ivoire, launching a 4,500-meter diamond drilling campaign across 20 strategic targets starting in February. A 2024 study estimates the project could produce 887,414 tonnes of nickel concentrate over a mine life of 16.1 years.

item.title: Global Aluminum Casting Market to Reach US$ 129.42 Billion by 2033 Driven by Automotive Lightweighting and EV Adoption
item.description: The aluminum casting market is growing due to real-time sensor technology enabling precise monitoring, reducing defects in casting for automotive and EV applications. Sustainability drives adoption of recycled aluminum through advanced techniques like high-integrity and vacuum die castings, meeting high-performance needs in aerospace and defense. This supports circular economy principles and environmental responsibility.

item.title: Early February 2026 Steel Pipe Market: Navigating the Peak of the Annual Holiday Hiatus
item.description: Asian steel pipe markets, including seamless and welded pipes, face a complete production halt due to Lunar New Year shutdowns, with logistics at minimal capacity and no spot availability. Production is expected to ramp up progressively post-holiday to fulfill backlogged orders for oil, gas, power, and infrastructure projects. This pause allows strategic preparation amid stable price foundations.

item.title: Goldman, Macquarie raise average nickel price forecasts for 2026 on tighter Indonesian supplies
item.description: Goldman Sachs raised its 2026 nickel price forecast to $17,200 per ton from $14,800, citing Indonesia's reduced ore supply to 260 million wet tons. Prices could peak at $18,700 per ton in Q2 2026 before falling to $15,500 by year-end due to later supply increases. Macquarie lifted its LME nickel forecast to $17,750 per ton, projecting a smaller global surplus of 90,000 tonnes.

item.title: Can-ification: Aluminium's Role in Circular Packaging
item.description: This article discusses aluminum cans as trusted solutions for sustainable beverage packaging, emphasizing their role in circular economy initiatives and sustainable packaging practices.

item.title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: HRC Steel fell to 971.06 USD/T on February 5, 2026, down 0.51% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 4.08%. Forecasts indicate trading at 986.72 USD/T by quarter-end and 1065.02 USD/T in 12 months.

item.title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 05.02.2026
item.description: Daily updates on global iron and steel prices, including Shanghai Futures Rebar terms and regional futures for Turkey, China, Europe, and North America as of February 3-4, 2026. Provides indices, analyses, and market comments.

item.title: Copper Prices Pull Back Sharply, Downstream Users Replenish Stocks Moderately, Spot Premiums Rise Significantly [SMM Southern China Spot Copper]
item.description: Spot copper prices in Guangdong fell sharply, with #1 copper cathode averaging 101,565 yuan/mt, down 3,075 yuan/mt from the previous day. Downstream users moderately replenished stocks amid the pullback, while traders actively purchased for arbitrage, leading to improved trading and significantly higher spot premiums. Guangdong inventory increased slightly due to higher arrivals.

item.title: Copper Prices Retreat Amid Demand Concerns
item.description: Copper prices reversed earlier gains amid signs of softening demand, with LME inventories rising in Asian warehouses and extra spot cargoes moving from Africa to China. China's Nonferrous Metals Industry Association forecasts a 5% increase in refined copper output this year, dampening investor enthusiasm despite calls for strategic reserves. This bearish sentiment overshadows initial positive reactions to reserve-boosting suggestions.

item.title: Latest updates on metals prices worldwide at 0200 GMT, Feb. 5
item.description: London Stock Exchange Group reported copper prices at 5.83 USD at 0200 GMT on Feb. 5. This update includes prices for other metals like gold at 4,988.00 USD and iron ore at 102.17 USD. The data reflects the latest worldwide metals pricing snapshot.

item.title: Refined copper output growth to slow in 2026: ICSG
item.description: Copper output growth is expected to slow to 0.9% in 2026, down from 3.4% in 2025, according to Paul White at the World Copper Conference. World copper mine production is forecast to rise by 2.3%, while refined copper usage grows by 2.1%, leading to a 150,000-metric ton market deficit.

item.title: Copper Prices Retreat Amid Demand Concerns
item.description: Copper prices reversed gains due to softening demand signals, rising LME inventories in Asia, and extra supply from Africa to China. China's Nonferrous Metals Industry Association forecasts a 5% increase in refined copper output this year. This offsets earlier positivity from calls to boost strategic reserves.

item.title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Drop Slightly on February 5 as US January ADP Employment Data Falls Short of Expectations
item.description: On February 5, SMM #1 refined nickel prices averaged 139,850 yuan/mt, down 1,750 yuan/mt from the previous day, amid weak US ADP employment data. The SHFE nickel futures contract (2603) closed at 133,510 yuan/mt, down 1.79%. Despite macro pressures, expectations for reduced nickel ore quotas in Indonesia suggest potential future rebounds.

item.title: Nickel prices surge on Feb 5 amid concerns over trade war ease
item.description: LME nickel futures rose by US$265/ton to close at US$15,535/ton on February 5. The nickel spot price also increased amid easing concerns over trade wars. This surge reflects positive market sentiment in the nickel sector.

item.title: [SMM Analysis] Nickel Sulphate Prices Edge Down as Chinese New Year Approaches Amid Weak Market Sentiment
item.description: The SMM battery-grade nickel sulphate index stood at 31,939 yuan/mt as of Thursday, with prices edging down ahead of Chinese New Year. Weak market sentiment contributed to the decline in nickel sulphate quotations. This reflects broader softening in nickel-related products.

item.title: Nornickel sees 2026 nickel output broadly in line with previous year
item.description: Russia's Nornickel, the world's largest palladium producer and major nickel producer, expects 2026 nickel output of 193,000–203,000 metric tons, broadly in line with 2025 production of 198,521 tons. The company attributes recent production declines to ore reserve depletion and Western sanctions restricting equipment access, but expects recovery by 2028 through development of the Oktyabrskoye deposit.

item.title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: Aluminum prices fell to 3,047.10 USD/T on February 5, 2026, down 0.17% from the previous day and 2.77% over the past month, though still 16.17% higher year-over-year. The price recently hit a 4-week low of 3031.00 USD/T. It retreated from a three-year high amid base metals pullback.

item.title: SHFE Cast Aluminum Alloy Warrants Drop to 66,546 mt on Feb 5
item.description: SHFE data indicates that on February 5, the total registered volume of cast aluminum alloy warrants decreased to 66,546 mt, down 245 mt from prior levels. This reflects ongoing adjustments in aluminum alloy inventory and market dynamics on the Shanghai Futures Exchange.

item.title: Vietnam-Backed Aluminum Project in Sekong Advances Toward 2028 Launch
item.description: A Vietnam-Phuong Group aluminum smelting project in Laos' Sekong Province aims for 1 million tonnes annual capacity by 2028, focusing on bauxite mining in a USD 1 billion complex. Construction began in late 2022, with ministerial oversight on February 3 emphasizing sustainable development.

item.title: World Copper Prices Today, Thursday, February 5, 2026: Sideways around $5.80 per Pound
item.description: World copper prices moved sideways around USD 5.80 per pound on February 5, 2026, following selling pressure and entering a consolidation phase. Market participants await macroeconomic sentiment and global industrial demand cues. Despite short-term bearish sentiment, long-term trends remain positive with a 30.29% yearly gain.

item.title: Comex Copper Settles 0.46% Lower at $5.7990 — Data Talk
item.description: Front-month Comex copper for February delivery settled at $5.7990 on February 5, 2026, down 0.46% or 2.70 cents per pound. It marked the seventh lowest settlement this year and continued a downward trend over recent sessions. Year-to-date, prices are up 3.00%, off 6.10% from the 2026 high.

item.title: Anglo American Cuts 2027 Copper View, Warns of Continued Weak Diamond Market - Commodity Comment
item.description: Anglo American revised its 2026 copper production guidance downward to 700,000-760,000 tonnes from 760,000-820,000 tonnes. The adjustment accounts for lower production levels at Collahuasi mine due to lower grade ore and refractory stockpiles through 2026. This reflects challenges in maintaining copper output.

item.title: Prysmian Group Data Breach in 2026 - Breachsense
item.description: Prysmian Group, an Italy-based multinational cable manufacturing company, suffered a data breach on February 05, 2026. The threat actor 0APT claimed responsibility, with a leak size of 14TB affecting prysmian.com. The company produces underground, submarine, industrial energy cables, optical fibers, and telecom systems worldwide.

item.title: Pillumina Honored with 2026 SEAL Sustainable Business Product Award for Advancing Sustainable Healthcare Packaging
item.description: Pillumina received the 2026 SEAL Sustainable Product Award for its infinitely recyclable aluminum prescription bottles, replacing single-use plastic ones used in over 7 billion U.S. prescriptions yearly. Aluminum's closed-loop lifecycle reduces plastic waste, microplastics, and landfill contributions compared to plastic's 3% recycle rate. The innovation supports pharmacies and healthcare in achieving sustainability goals.

item.title: Anglo lowers 2026 copper production guidance following lower 2025 output
item.description: Diversified miner Anglo American reported a 14% quarter-on-quarter decrease in copper production to 170,000 tons in the fourth quarter and has lowered its 2026 copper production guidance. The company expects production to rise to between 700,000 and 760,000 tonnes in 2026, following weaker 2025 output.

item.title: ArcelorMittal pins 2026 upturn on EU import curbs; North America to ship more at higher prices in Q1
item.description: ArcelorMittal expects improved steel shipments and prices in North America in Q1 2026 following resolution of Mexico-related disruptions and recent price increases. In Europe, the EU's new import regime and Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM) are projected to reduce steel imports by 10 million tonnes versus 2024, boosting domestic utilization and margins. The company reactivated its blast furnace in Mexico in late January after maintenance.

item.title: ArcelorMittal expects tariffs, CBAM to restore production levels and profit in 2026
item.description: ArcelorMittal anticipates world ex-China apparent steel demand to grow 2% in 2026, with production and shipments rising across regions due to operational improvements and trade protections like tariffs and CBAM. In Europe, these measures are expected to reduce imports by 10 million metric tons, resetting capacity utilization higher and restoring profitability. New capacity, including EAF expansions, is set for commissioning in 2026.

item.title: Copper Pressured by Supply Concerns
item.description: Copper held below $5.85 per pound on Thursday after losing nearly 4% in the previous session, weighed down by rising supplies in top consumer China. An industry group forecasted that China’s refined copper output will likely rise by about 5% this year following a 10% increase last year.

item.title: Copper Slips on Rising Inventories
item.description: Copper fell about 1% to $6 per pound on Wednesday, trimming gains amid rising inventories at major trading hubs in Shanghai, London, and New York. The red metal decoupled from gold and silver, which climbed on safe-haven demand, as investors assessed soft price data.

item.title: Can a ‘sustainable’ fungicide save France’s vineyards from climate-driven disease?
item.description: France has banned traditional fungicides, prompting the adoption of a sustainable alternative to copper-pesticides developed by UK-based Eden Research to combat mildew and mould in vineyards exacerbated by climate change. This innovation offers winemakers a viable, eco-friendly option to protect harvests. It represents a positive step in sustainable agriculture amid environmental pressures.

item.title: February 6, 2026 Jinshi Futures Morning Report: SHFE adjusts the
item.description: Mysteel reports China's primary aluminum production in January 2026 reached 3.8385 million tons, up 3.24% year-on-year and 0.26% month-on-month, with average daily output at 123,800 tons. This preliminary data highlights steady growth in primary aluminum output amid market surveys.

item.title: February 6, 2026 Steel Market Summary – International Australia´s Bisalloy Steels Advances Further Onto World Stage
item.description: Bisalloy Steels has secured CE certification for its structural grades, consolidating its global presence in Europe. The summary also covers New Zealand Steel's Glenbrook EAF project on track for a resurgent 2026, vital for the nation's economy. BlueScope Steel's new chief outlines the 2026 agenda amid economic pressures like RBA rate hikes.

item.title: Anglo American Lowers Production Target, Overnight SHFE and LME Copper Prices Fall Together [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
item.description: LME copper closed at $12,855/mt overnight on February 6, 2026, down 1.42% after a volatile session. SHFE copper fell then slightly rebounded, closing at 101,100 yuan/mt on February 5. Prices face pressure from rising US dollar index, inventory buildup, stable supply, and weak demand; further declines expected.

item.title: Trading was sluggish for spot copper during the day, with overall transactions limited [SMM Yangshan spot copper]
item.description: Spot copper trading was sluggish on February 6, 2026, with limited transactions and warrant prices at $28-46/mt for February QP, flat from prior day. Overall market activity remained subdued amid ongoing price pressures.

item.title: Vale's copper ambition is to produce 1Mt/y
item.description: Vale's base metals unit aims to produce one million tons of copper per year by developing existing assets. This target exceeds previous output goals for the company. The ambition highlights efforts to expand copper production capacity.

item.title: Ero Copper's Record Output: Assessing the Commodity Balance & Liquidity Impact
item.description: Ero Copper provided 2026 production guidance of 67,500–77,500 tonnes, indicating cautious growth after strong 2025 performance. This follows record output in Q4 2025, though gold production is expected to decline. The guidance assesses impacts on commodity balance and liquidity.

item.title: AWS to Source Low Carbon Nuton Copper from Rio Tinto for U.S. Data Center Infrastructure
item.description: Rio Tinto and AWS have partnered under a two-year agreement for AWS to use Nuton copper in U.S. data center components. Nuton's technology uses naturally occurring microorganisms to extract copper from primary sulphide ores, eliminating traditional concentrators and smelters while reducing water use and emissions intensity compared to conventional methods.

item.title: Nickel price spikes more than 10% as Chinese buying fuels metals surge
item.description: Nickel prices spiked over 10% in London, hitting $18,785/ton, driven by Chinese investor buying and production risks in Indonesia despite oversupply. This extends a 30% rally since mid-December, reviving the LME nickel contract after past challenges. Broader base metals like copper and tin also surged amid high-volume Asian trading.

item.title: Indonesia cuts 2026 nickel quota, global prices jump immediately
item.description: Indonesia's reduction in its 2026 nickel production quota has sparked supply concerns, causing an immediate jump in global nickel prices. This policy shift counters ongoing oversupply issues in the market.

item.title: Ivanhoe Electric Plans Expanded Copper, Nickel Exploration in Côte d'Ivoire in 2026
item.description: Ivanhoe Electric and partner Sama Resources plan to accelerate copper and nickel exploration at the Samapleu-Grata project in Côte d'Ivoire starting in February 2026 with a 4,500-meter diamond drilling campaign across 20 targets. A 2024 study estimates potential production of over 887,000 tonnes of nickel concentrate and 621,000 tonnes of copper concentrate over a 16-year mine life. The initiative aims to demonstrate the project's district-scale potential amid global demand for critical minerals.

item.title: High Aluminum Prices Suppress Stockpiling Demand for the Chinese New Year, Extended Holiday Periods for Alloys and Downstream Die-Casting
item.description: High aluminum prices are suppressing stockpiling demand ahead of Chinese New Year, with A00 aluminum dropping 420 yuan/mt to 23,340 yuan/mt and ADC12 to 23,600 yuan/mt on February 5. Aluminum alloy futures closed up 1.07% at 22,150 yuan/mt, showing potential for a technical rebound after oversold conditions. Secondary aluminum plants plan production suspensions from February 5-13, with resumptions post-holiday.

item.title: Century's Hawesville smelter sale in the context of US primary aluminum
item.description: Century Aluminum's sale of its idled Hawesville smelter highlights challenges in US primary aluminum production, with prior plans to restart capacity to over 220,000 metric tons per year adding about 10% to national output. Even at full capacity across US smelters, the country would remain reliant on imports for most primary aluminum needs. Related expansions include Arconic’s Davenport plant doubling high-purity aluminum to over 40,000 metric tons annually.

item.title: Danantara Begins $5.8B Aluminum Smelter Project in West Kalimantan
item.description: Danantara has officially started a $5.8 billion aluminum smelter project in West Kalimantan, marking a significant new development in regional production capacity.

item.title: The growing role of critical minerals in global innovation
item.description: Demand for critical minerals like nickel for clean energy technologies is projected to rise over 3.4 times by 2040, creating challenges for sustainable mining amid the net-zero push. The article emphasizes the need for collaboration among mining, governments, and tech leaders to mine responsibly, focusing on environmental stewardship and community benefits. Leaders at the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting 2026 will discuss balancing growth and protection.

item.title: World Economic Forum Insights; Global Cathode Active Material ...
item.description: S&P Global forecasts strong growth in cathode active materials demand to 5 million metric tons by 2030, with nickel-based chemistries facing pressure from rising LFP batteries. Capacity expansions in North America and Europe aim to reduce China's dominance, amid ongoing oversupply. This impacts nickel innovation in sustainable battery technologies.

item.title: Macro and Fundamentals Present a Mix of Positive and Negative Factors, Aluminum Prices Expected to Consolidate with Mainly Downside Risks
item.description: LME aluminum closed at $3,026/mt on February 5, down 1.08%, while SHFE aluminum rose 0.79% to 23,570 yuan/mt. Spot A00 aluminum fell to 23,340 yuan/mt amid weakening futures and holiday production suspensions extending 8-20 days. Downstream demand contracts, with secondary alloy prices expected to hover at highs but face slight downward pressure.

item.title: Nickel Industries showcases sustainability in quarterly update
item.description: Nickel Industries Limited reported achieving a zero Lost Time Injury Frequency Rate (LTIFR) with 17.7 million safe man-hours over 12 months as of December 2025. The company completed a strategic acquisition of a 10 percent stake in Excelsior Nickel Cobalt and received national recognition through the Indonesia Leadership Award 2025 and CNBC Indonesia's Excellence in Sustainability Leadership Award.

item.title: Simar Bedi Leads Canada's Recycling Revolution With Record-Breaking Innovation at Sol Recycling
item.description: Sol Recycling founder Simar Bedi is advancing sustainability through record-breaking innovations in aluminum and metal recycling in Canada. The efforts position the company as a leader in environmental innovation and circular economy practices for aluminum materials.

item.title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
item.description: Steel prices fell to 3,055 CNY/T on February 6, 2026, down 0.81% from the previous day. Steel rebar futures dropped to around CNY 3,070 a ton, a one-month low, due to Chinese steel mills trimming production ahead of Lunar New Year. Blast furnace utilization stayed above 86%, with daily hot metal output rising week-on-week.

item.title: Copper price dips below $13,000 with stockpiles, China demand in focus
item.description: Copper prices fell below $13,000 per ton as investors focused on rising inventories and weakening demand from Chinese buyers. Daily refined copper spot trading volumes in China declined to 25,300 tons, though State Grid Corporation of China announced a 35% increase in fixed-asset investment for power infrastructure.

item.title: Copper Futures Hit Record High of $13,000/Ton in 2026 Metals Rally
item.description: Copper futures surged to a record high of $13,000 per ton, driven by strong demand from AI infrastructure and supply disruptions. Global demand is projected to surge from 28 million tons in 2025 to 42 million tons by 2040, though analysts warn the current rally may be unsustainable.

item.title: Can copper hit $15,000 in 2026?
item.description: LME cash copper prices reached an all-time high of $13,300 per metric ton on January 6, 2026, marking a 50% year-on-year increase. Major producers including Chile, Peru, and the Democratic Republic of Congo face significant supply constraints, with production disruptions from labor strikes, accidents, and declining ore grades affecting global output.

item.title: LME aluminium prices record cash offer rising to $3,045/t while inventories slide downwards
item.description: Aluminum prices on the London Metal Exchange rose sharply on February 6, with both cash and forward contracts reporting gains. The LME aluminum opening stocks declined to 490,975 tonnes on February 6 from 492,975 tonnes on February 5, marking a 0.4% decrease, while cancelled warrants dropped sharply by 3.82%.

item.title: Electricity fees 'too high' in UK steel production
item.description: UK steel firms will continue to pay 25% more for electricity than European rivals despite government intervention. Trade body UK Steel states this disparity will add £26m to members' bills compared to France. Ministers maintain a bright future for UK steel-making.

item.title: Bearings of Change: SKF's roadmap for efficient motion
item.description: SKF Industrial’s bearing innovations emphasize sustainability through advanced materials like corrosion-resistant coatings, lightweight composites, and hybrid ceramic bearings, extending service life and reducing raw material needs. These solutions have driven up to 25% lower carbon emissions, significant grease savings, and longer maintenance intervals in sectors like mining, cement, and power generation. Future developments include smart, sensor-integrated bearings and additive manufacturing to support a low-carbon economy and circularity.

item.title: Precious Metals Forecast (Feb 9, 2026): Gold Holds ...
item.description: Copper has hit an all-time high of $14,527/ton, driven by cabling needs for AI data centers. The median forecast for 2026 is $11,975/ton, positioning it as a top-performing base metal. Nickel is stabilizing around $17,235/ton with support from Indonesian supply.

item.title: Market Watch: Monday 9th February, 2026
item.description: Explorer Cobre is reportedly closing in on a deal to buy a 25,000t-per-annum copper cathode operation in Chile. An associated $50 million raising at 15c per new share is also said to be in progress. This acquisition would expand Cobre's copper production capacity.

item.title: Stuart Kimball Shares Insights on How Technology Is Transforming Arizona's Mining Industry
item.description: The article explores how advanced technologies are reshaping Arizona's mining industry with a focus on safety, efficiency, and environmental stewardship. It highlights innovations like Florence Copper's in-situ copper recovery (ISCR), which produces 75% fewer carbon emissions and uses 65% less energy compared to traditional open-pit mining, and Resolution Copper's block cave mining technique that reduces environmental impact.

item.title: It All Comes Back to Supply Chains
item.description: This article discusses how supply chain challenges for critical minerals are reshaping the technology industry, with AWS's early 2026 agreement with Rio Tinto to secure copper from Arizona representing the first new U.S.-mined copper supply in over a decade. The piece emphasizes that while this deal is strategically important, the projected 30,000 metric tons over several years represents only a fraction of copper needed for AI and electrification growth.

item.title: SMM Nickel Midday Review: Nickel prices rebounded slightly on February 9 as the central bank increased its gold holdings
item.description: On February 9, the SMM #1 refined nickel price ranged from 133,900-145,000 yuan/mt, averaging 139,450 yuan/mt, up 3,650 yuan/mt from the previous day. The SHFE nickel contract (2603) closed the morning at 134,630 yuan/mt, up 1.53%, amid sluggish pre-holiday trading and a technical rebound. Spot demand remains weak, with focus post-holiday on Indonesia's nickel ore quota policy.

item.title: DMCI Mining eyes record 3-million WMT nickel output for 2026
item.description: DMCI Mining targets 3 million WMT of nickel ore production in 2026 from mines in Zambales and Palawan, driven by higher prices enabling sales of lower-grade ore at $26 per WMT. The company saw 33% production growth to 2 million WMT in 2025, with shipments up 31% to 1.9 million WMT. Rising global nickel prices, boosted by Indonesia's capacity limits, support expansion plans.

item.title: SMM Nickel Sulphate Daily Review: Pre-Holiday Trading Remained Weak, Nickel Salt Prices Held Steady
item.description: On February 9, the SMM battery-grade nickel sulphate index was 31,646 yuan/mt, with quotes ranging 31,400-32,000 yuan/mt amid weak pre-holiday trading. Nickel salt prices remained steady despite sluggish market activity. This reflects ongoing trends in the nickel derivatives market tied to refined nickel movements.

item.title: DMCI Mining hits record nickel output as Zambales, Long Point ramp-up
item.description: DMCI Mining achieved record 2 million WMT nickel ore production in 2025, up 33% year-on-year, with shipments at 1.9 million WMT, fueled by Zambales output and Long Point mine ramp-up. Philippine FOB laterite nickel ore prices for 1.5% grade rose 26% to $45.70, improving fundamentals. The company eyes further growth amid recovering nickel market and new capacity.

item.title: DMCI Mining eyes record 3-million WMT nickel output for 2026
item.description: DMCI Mining Corp. plans to achieve a record-high 3 million wet metric tons (WMT) of nickel ore production in 2026 by operating three mine sites, including the pending Long Point mine in Palawan. The company reported a 33% increase in 2025 production to 2 million WMT, driven by Zambales operations. Favorable nickel prices, boosted by Indonesia's capacity limits, enable sales of lower-grade ore at attractive rates.

item.title: DMCI Mining says nickel output up 33% in 2025; Long Point mine set to start operations
item.description: DMCI Mining Corp. achieved 33% higher nickel ore production at 2 million WMT in 2025, with shipments up 31% to 1.9 million WMT, fueled by Zambales mines and initial Long Point project in Palawan. The Long Point mine awaits final permits and could start within weeks, supporting a target of 3 million WMT shipments in 2026 amid strong prices. The company has rehabilitated areas at its Quezon mine ahead of schedule.

item.title: Canada Nickel Announces US$32 Million Bridge Loan Facility with Auramet International Inc.
item.description: Canada Nickel secured a US$32 million bridge loan from Auramet, closing by February 9, 2026, to fund its Crawford Nickel Sulphide Project, due May 2026 with 1% monthly interest. The project features robust economics from a prior PEA, including a 120,000 tonnes/day plant for nickel and magnetite concentrates. This supports advancement amid strong nickel demand.

item.title: Prysmian Signs €2.3 Billion Contract for UK Power Link Project
item.description: Italian cable maker Prysmian signed a contract worth over €2.3 billion with SP Energy Networks and National Grid to build the Eastern Green Link 4 power transmission link connecting the electrical grids of Scotland and England.

item.title: World's Top Cable Maker Sees US Copper Tariff as Opportunity
item.description: Prysmian, which acquired Texas-based Encore Wire for $4 billion, expressed support for President Trump's planned 50% copper tariff, stating it will bolster the American supply chain. The company believes its vertical integration and domestic copper sourcing position it favorably relative to competitors.

item.title: Prysmian, Versalis Launch Chemical Recycling Chain for Plastic Cable Waste in Italy
item.description: Prysmian and Versalis established a strategic partnership for chemical recycling of end-of-life and production cable plastics in Italy. Using Versalis's Hoop® technology, the initiative will recover up to 60% of difficult-to-recycle XLPE insulation, with pilot operations scheduled to begin in the second half of 2026.

item.title: Acciaierie d'Italia to start preferential negotiations with Azerbaijani consortium on acquisition of former Ilva plants
item.description: Extraordinary commissioners of Acciaierie d’Italia and ILVA in extraordinary administration have requested authorization from Italy’s Ministry of Enterprises and Made in Italy to begin preferential negotiations with an Azerbaijani consortium (Baku Steel Company CJSC and Azerbaijan Investment Company OJSC) for the sale of the former Ilva steel plants.[8] Ten proposals had been received by the January 10 deadline, and the chosen consortium was selected based on criteria including financial stability, industrial sustainability, and expected benefits for employment and local communities.[8]
